Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, lovely setting, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Oldhuds
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Palazzo Abadessa in September last year for three days for part of our honeymoon trip to Italy. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We caught a private water taxi to the hotel from airport. The rest of the time we jumped on and off vaporettas which go to stops close to the hotel. The decor in the hotel is wonderful - really beautiful oldy-worldy feel but still very swish/stylish. There were wooden beams on our bedroom ceiling, gorgeous chandeliers in the hall way and the rooms had everything we could need. We were also able to lean out of our bedroom window to see gondaliers going by. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the breakfasts were lovely. The two men on reception were extremely welcoming. They even gave us a bottle of complimentary sparkling wine as it was our honeymoon! The hotel was in a good location. We didnt hear any noise at night. We also loved spending time relaxing in the garden at the back of the hotel which contain lovely gold and green statues. Watch out for the ants though! The reception staff also provided us with names of recommended restaurants to try on the back streets (much better food and reasonably priced). We hope to return to the hotel on an anniversary in a couple of years time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: Staff was especailly helpful and the room very clean. If you are leaving for the airport splurge and take the water taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Service”
Reviews.Author: Cathy V
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel that includes modern amenities without giving up the traditional venetian charm. The hotel staff members were extremely friendly and helpfull. We had fresh fruit and prosecco in the room upon arrival as well as a complementary upgraded room. The hotel is in an excellent location as well (although can be a bit difficult to find when walking). I would stay in this hotel again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_Richie
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay... amazing, personal, service where nothing was too much trouble. Some great little touches like fresh fruit and a bottle of prosecco waiting for us in the room. Breakfast hit the spot. Location is a little back behind the main road/path, but we arranged a water taxi, so that wasn't an issue for us. Take one of the regular boats around to the main square if you don't feel like walking. Overall a great experience that made our trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “WOW what a find”
Reviews.Author: pvanian
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect, we felt a part of Venice and at home at the same time. Tucked away just off the main canal but a only a minute from a wonderful selection of cafe's and shops. A gorgeous setting with very accommodating staff (the beds for the children were too hard so they changed the mattresses immediately) and a breakfast to die for with a large selection of Venetian pastries as well as fresh fruit and anything else you could want. All the best of Venice in one building. We had a junior suite overlooking the walled garden and it was stunning. A fairy tale experience that we and the children loved. We could not have asked for more for our trip. Convenient for the Rialto, San Marco Piazza and Murano with very good transportation close by. I highly recommend this hotel as it made our Venice Carnival experience perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Small and perfect for a real "taste of Venice"”
Reviews.Author: goanpearl
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Abadessa is a small palazzo that gives a wonderful sample of the style and elegance of historic Venice. It is quietly situated with elaborately decorated public rooms and bedrooms. Set on a canal and with its own garden, yet still in a very convenient location - the vaporetto on the Grand Canal is 2minutes walk. The establishment is very well run, spotlessly clean and the staff are all marvellous - very professional and helpful. They only serve breakfast - but there Venice is full of places to eat and the breakfast is very good. If you like to escape from the crowds and feel as if you have found somewhere private and special Palazzo Abadessa will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Quite place to stay but very convnient to travel by public transportation. Very friendly and helpful staff. Room was nice and comfortable. There was a full-sized, modern bathroom. The daily continental breakfast was very good. The price of the rooms were a little high.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Gidi W
Reviews.Content: First, thanks to Darwin. He is extremely helpful and caring Second, the room (we had the golden one) was great, the breakfast was really good (comparing to standard breakfast in European hotels), the location is excellent (near the best ice-cream place - GROM) and the place itself is beautiful. I highly recommended staying there while you are in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Style”
Reviews.Author: kiltieanne
Reviews.Content: A wonderful and stylish place to stay tucked away from the desperate tourist crush of central Venice. We spent three nights is one of the smaller rooms overlooking the canal. As we were so busy sightseeing the room was perfect, the breakfasts were a feast and eating in the garden such a serene beginning to our daily adventures. We found some excellent restaurants within walking distance and made one booking with the help of the staff, well in advance for a special birthday meal. We loved the area, found the traghetto an economical form of gondola and enjoyed "getting lost". The passes for both churches "Chorus" and water transport are invaluable as you can hop on and off at will without spending a fortune or wearing yourself out. We were so well looked after and look forward to another visit.

Reviews.Title: “November Break 2011”
Reviews.Author: LondonBig_G
Reviews.Content: We made our way up from Naples by train to Venice - a five and a half hour trip. Hotel was a bit difficult to find in the dark, as we did not have good directions (it was booked at the last minute and so I did not even have the address!). The shopkeepers near the hotel did not seem to know of its existence! It is set back in a little alleyway about 100 metres from the main walkway down the right bank. The hotel is unusual in that, to gain access, you walk in a large gateway into a walled garden, complete with fig trees (and figs). The hotel is a lovely old palace and only has 15 bedrooms. The downstairs is given over to a cosy reception (they did not stint on heating) and a communal area where breakfast is served, in ducal surroundings. The bedroom was not huge, but not bad by Venice standards. It was boiling hot when I went in and so I turned the heating off and turned the heater in the lovely large bathroom on - this proved to be sufficient to heat the bedroom well. The bedroom had large windows that opened on to the garden. About the only criticism I can find is that the view of the garden was slightly blocked by an awning. Enjoyed a lovely night's sleep in the comfortable bed. The hotel proved to be very central - 2 minutes from the Vaporetta, 4 minutes from Billa supermarket, 10 minutes from Rialto. Breakfast was made up of a lovely spread of meats, cheeses fruits, boiled eggs, bakes, cereals. We were served beautiful frothy milky coffee. Highlight of breakfast was an absolutely fabulous almond marzipan cake. The staff in the hotel could not be more friendly and helpful. They said we should view the hotel as â€œour home in Veniceâ€� - and we do! I have been to Venice many times and this is the most charming and comfortable hotel I have stayed in there. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfetto”
Reviews.Author: EricH61
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else who stays at the Abadessa, I was completely charmed and utterly satisfied. This is the authentic Venetian experience, with staff as gracious and accomodating as you can be. We stayed for 6 nights in the President's Suite. If you have the opportunity to do so, it's worth the splurge -- two levels, balcony overlooking the canal in a quiet residential neighborhood (albeit steps from busy Strada Nova and a busy Grand Canal vaporetto stop). The antique decor makes you feel like you are on a movie set. And the breakfast! My partner and I are still talking about it months later -- we loved waking up to that sumptuous spread every morning. The neighborhood is really the best part of all. Rather than "out of the way" or "off the beaten track," I would actually characterize the location of the hotel as "central" -- particularly if you want to explore the entire city, rather just than the San Marco-Rialto-Accademia triumverate (not that they aren't essential as well!). The Strada Nova is a bustling main street that would be worth visiting no matter where you were staying. And the hotel's Cannaregio location makes it much easier to pick up ferries from Fondamenta Nove to Murano, Burano, Torcello or San Michele (the historic cemetery), or to walk to the main train station for a day trip to Padua. In other words, it really was a magical experience. And don't forget to take a water taxi from the airport -- the door-to-door journey is also worth the splurge!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at the Palazzo Abadessa”
Reviews.Author: dnl_in_illinois
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Abadessa offers much for the visitor to Venice for the first time which we were. I'll attempt to answer the questions I had when looking for hotels in Venice. Access. As far as getting to the hotel from the airport it is convenient from 2 approaches. If you wish to keep costs down, you can find your way to a vaporetto and exit at the Ca' d'Oro stop. A Google map will show you the way from there to the hotel. It is a short walk and for a minimally physical able person a breeze to get to. We elected to hire a water taxi and once in Venice -- climbed aboard what I'd call a "speed boat" that took us right to the canal entrance to the hotel. We climbed from the boat and walked into the lobby. Same for our departure from the hotel to the ships port. You may want to look into sharing the cost of this as it is not inexpensive but very convenient. The location is good although not in the mainstream area of Venice. It is close to many restaurants, shopping and the vaporetto. It is and within a reasonable walking distance to for starters, the Rialto bridge and area. I'm not the greatest at walking distances yet we found the distances very acceptable. We even did a walking tour on our own from St Mark's Square back to the hotel. My point here is that while I had concerns initially about location -- that concern was totally unfounded. The hotel itself is what it is. It's an old palace. To us it was charming and interesting. The morning breakfasts included were ample and we loved sitting in the private courtyard which is peaceful and inviting. We sat there often upon returning from our excursions into Venice. We had a suite on the 2nd floor. The room was huge with a fresco painted on the ceiling. You do need to climb stairs to get to the 2nd and 3rd levels. Noise level? Not an issue. Service? Outstanding as the people go out of their way to assure your stay is acceptable. We had dinner one evening at Osteria Ca' D'Oro (La Vedova). You can check out reviews on Trip Advisor and decide for yourself. We loved it. Don't be reluctant about this hotel as it is a good choice. I'm sure there are others that offer comparable accommodations - - - but this is among the good ones.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Cannaregio”
Reviews.Author: Warren J
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Abadessa lived up to it's reputation! Upon our arrival by water taxi we were greeted to "our home in Venice" by Darwin ( who was gracious throughout our stay and made every effort to make it more memorable ). The Palazzo is a true Gem, decorated in the classic Venetian Style with original (school of) Tintoretto's,frescoed ceilings,period furnishings and Murano chandeliers. We had the Red Junior Suite which was appointed nicely and upon arrival met us with a complimentary bottle of Prosecco and fresh fruit.The daily Continental breakfast was very good and can be enjoyed in the (rare for Venice) garden with classic and modern sculpture. The Palazzo is located in the Canneregio neighborhood, far enough away from the crazy crowds of San Marco but close enough to walk to everything or take the vaporreto from the Ca' d'Oro station which is very close.This is a great neighborhood with many hidden treasures to explore! The only disappointment is that we had only three nights here, however we will again stay at the Palazzo Abadessa on our next trip to Venice!! W.J.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in a Walkable City”
Reviews.Author: Leslie C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four days in July 2011, as the first part of our honeymoon, before a week-long cruise, and it was the best part of the whole trip! The rates were very reasonable, especially for Venice, the hotel was easy to find (down a little alley), the room was lovely and lacked nothing. The included breakfasts that we were fortunate enough to be able to eat the private garden were delicious and filling, and the staff was wonderful, especially Darwin, the concierge. He was cheerful and helpful from booking to check-out, and coming back to his smiling face every day after sight-seeing was like coming home to a kindly uncle. Palazzo Abadessa isn't close to the main tourist areas, but we found it easy and quick to get everywhere we needed or wanted to go, especially as it's close to a vaporetto stop. My husband and I are definitely looking forward to returning to Venice, and when we do we will be staying at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place and worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: hinona
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days here and were so sorry to leave. Everything about it was great. Location, staff, facilities,room. Prices are very reasonable for Venice and this place lacked not one thing. The breakfast were fabulous! Would definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “Best concierge”
Reviews.Author: Mittens67
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is Darwin, the concierge, who did everything possible to make our stay in Italy wonderful. He sent us to excellent restaurants (not touristy and moderately priced), researched and booked a day trip for us to Florence, and called Hertz to make sure that our rental car, for the second leg of our trip, would have automatic transmission. We can't say enough about him. Another plus is the hotel's location -- convenient enough for sightseeing yet a nice respite from the throngs of tourists around San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gypsyscotland
Reviews.Content: spent 5 nights here last week, and must agree that the location is good. Breakfast adequate, and the staff helpful. The room was a little small and dark, and the shower facility needed updated. However it was clean,and the antique theme was well thought out. However, they could have been a little more generous with the lighting on the first floor landing, more off than on in the evening! The little garden was a pleasant place to have breakfast before exploring Venice, which proved very easy with the vaporettos! and for 33 euros you had unlimited travel on them for 3 days! We found a few very good restaurants in the vicinity of the Hotel, and a wonderful ice-cream shop called GROM which was just a minute away! Would we stay here again? Yes, we think so, but Venice doesn't come cheap, so don't expect a bargain!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Venice!!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravelcat
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk into the hotel, you will know that this is the place to be. If you love antiques and an authentic Venetian atmosphere and decor, then this is the place for you. Be sure to wander around and take in the details, as they have made sure your senses will be overwhelmed by what you see. The rooms are amazing - we had a canal view which was fabulous! Since the garden is very nicely maintained, I am sure that view is great too, and quieter. The hotel staff is very attentive and will make sure you have everything you need. We arrived unexpectedly late the first night, and no restaurants were open, but Darwin made sure we had something to eat in our room. The breakfast buffet is the best you will find in Venice, and the setting you eat it in is also perfect. We stayed in two other hotels while in Venice, but I was very sad to leave the Abadessa. Had I known how perfect it was going to be, I would have booked it for our entire stay in Venice. This is one of those extremely memorable places that you will forever have fond memories of. We will be back, I am sure!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly oasis in Venice”
Reviews.Author: minouche448
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Abadessa is in a wonderful location close to the Ca D'Oro vaporetto stop, a big plus if you're coming from the train station or are dropping off a rental car on the outskirts of Venice. Water taxis to the hotel cost around 65 Euros vs 6.50 Euros pp for a vaporetto. The palazzo is hidden away in Cannaregio, a bustling but non-touristic neighborhood full of excellent trattorias, and has a beautiful garden, and a friendly and helpful staff. As others have mentioned, an excellent breakfast is served in the garden. At first sight, we were slightly disappointed in our room -- it was quite small compared to the rooms shown on the hotel's website. However, it was well and comfortably furnished, with a good bathroom, and it was remarkably quiet and nice to return to after a long day's wandering around the city. We would definitely return to the Palazzo Abadessa, and recommend it without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and accommodation”
Reviews.Author: icehouse45
Reviews.Content: Wow what a find. This hotel was like living in your own palazzo in Venice. The staff were amazing, thank you Marco for your outstanding assistance and patience at all times as I tried to find things in Venice and always available with a glass of wine and some crisps in the supurb gardens at the end of a long, hot day. Although i didnt have a room overlooking a canal i didnt mind as the room was a suite with 2 couches, a wide screen tv and a big bathroom. The garden was a beautiful place to relax for breakfast or at any time during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: sue g
Reviews.Content: A superb place to stay in Venice. Very quiet but convenient location. On turning off the bustling Strada Nova you leave all noise behind and enter an oasis of calm, splendour and comfort. We loved the garden, the hallway where we took breakfast on our one rainy morning (and we welcomed the great umbrellas for loan) and our fabulous room (the one with the painted ceiling). We were very well looked after but in an unobtrusive way. Breakfast was lovely - lots of fresh beautifully prepred fruit and a wide selection of bakery items as well as meats, cheeses etc and freshly prepared coffee. Staff were always on hand if needed and the services in the room (bathrobes, slippers, fruit, prosecco as well as shutter closing) just right. We spent ages choosing the hotel for our wedding trip and could not have done better.

Reviews.Title: “CHARMING PLACE WHERE WE WOULD COME BACK AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: mbutterfly1977
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve just come back from the most pleasurable trip to Venice weâ€™ve experienced so far. For two days we stayed at Palazzo Abadessa, which we enjoyed very, very much. First of all, the whole hotel is very welcoming. Our greeter at the check-in said to us â€œwelcome to your home in Veniceâ€� which I thought sounded a little too sweet, but in fact they are taking these words very serious. In the room weâ€™ve found a bottle of Proseco as a welcoming gift that as frequent travelers we may say it doesnâ€™t happen too often nowadays. Hotel in overall is beautiful. Our green room with the view on the garden was simply charming, but most of all youâ€™ll be enchanted by the most beautiful surroundings of your breakfasts that happen to be served in the garden. Perhaps, the location youâ€™ll find too far from the center point of the city â€“ Piazza San Marco â€“ but the walk is so captivating that eventually youâ€™ll realize that this is what you came to Venice for anyway.

Reviews.Title: “A charming quiet oasis close to the action”
Reviews.Author: RWOS
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay immensely and hope to return some day. Quiet and relaxing and just steps from all the action in Venice. Breakfast in the garden is a good place to plan your day

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, hidden gem in Ca'dOro”
Reviews.Author: TravelingfromSF_8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3.5 days for our 10-year wedding anniversary trip. The decor of the hotel is very historic and charming. You can spend time in the quiet garden at any time and feel like you are secluded from the hustle and bustle of the Venice streets. The breakfasts were fresh everyday - fresh fruit, yogarts, cakes, danishes, cheeses, french rolls, etc. You have fresh fruit in the room when you arrive, along with a bottle of tasty Prosecco. Friendly staff make you feel royal. Location is great too - we would walk everywhere. We'd definitely head back there for sure!

Reviews.Title: “We came home and immediately told our friends to book for their 20th anniversary”
Reviews.Author: thrilledinmilford
Reviews.Content: It is a little offputting when you first arrive because you walk down an alleyway that is not so clean, but then you turn the corner and a little further down is this beautiful courtyard with flowers and birds and you are actually in a palace from the 15th century. There was a famous German director who was there with his family for their anniversary and he was debuting his movie at the Venice Film Festival...very down to earth people. Everyone there was smiling and happy...the breakfast was fabulous..the best chocolate croissants (thank God they were small). The service is wonderful....the only complaint I have is that my medication went missing. Thank God the farmacia replaced it without a prescription....that would never fly in the USA. We will definitely return as it is so quiet in the Palazzo you would never know you are in the city, Ask the conceirge where they eat as that is what we did and you can't go wrong!!!!! Enjoy. Ask about the meatball place that people wait on line for hours and is around the corner from hotel. We missed it because they were not in the mood to open that day LOL. You've gotta love Italy!!!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm in a hot busy city”
Reviews.Author: kimtendo64
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Abadessa is close to all the sights - approximately 15 minutes walk to Piazza San Marco and 5 minutes to a vaporetto on the Grand Canal. However, it is situated in a very peaceful street away from the bustle. When returning from the touristy areas it feels like returning to an oasis of old world Venice. The decor is rich and they have tried to retain the original feel of a Venetian palazzo. The garden is beautiful, especially in the morning when you have breakfast outside. When I was there I could hear the sounds of opera, piano and birds. It felt like going back in time!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful peaceful place in busy Venice”
Reviews.Author: mrsail
Reviews.Content: The Abadessa was quiet and comfortable after a hectic day in Venice. The staff was very accomodating and friendly. Breakfast was delicious and varied and served in the beautiful garden. A wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay for the Venice experience”
Reviews.Author: LaRoseInShanghai
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in this hotel for four days and we loved it. Staff is outstanding, friendly, effective and nothing was too much trouble. Great tips on local sites, restaurants and walks. I would highly recommend this as the hotel to stay for the real Vencizian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Serenissima, the Hotel Palaazo Abadessa, Lives Up to the Name Given to the Republic of Venice”
Reviews.Author: nursemary312
Reviews.Content: As my daughter and I were deposited from the water taxi into a large, beautful room--which became our breakfast and relaxing space for the following 4 days--we felt a stillness and calm wash over us. Soon we were warmly greated by Mateo, the evening concierge who took us to our room with a canal view that we had requested. This small, but comfortable room had ceiling beams revealing 16th c etechings, matched by modern bath facilities. At breakfast the first morning, we met the wonderful concierge, Darwin who daily made sure to ask whether we slept well and inquired that the breakfast met our needs. Upon returning in the afternoon, he made sure that a cappucino and sweets were available and that we had dinner reservations within easy walking distance. After 4 wonderful Carnival days, it was with sadness that we left this special hotel, whose staff, including the room maid, smiling waitress with morning coffee, as well as Mateo and Darwin represented a welcoming family. This hotel provides a high quality experience that is quietly effecient, paying attention to detail that is always guest-centered. In a heartbeat we would return to the Palazzo Abadessa. Mary & Laura

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: ernstsg
Reviews.Content: 1. Hotel is in very convenient location, near to vaporetto station (Ca'D Oro) 2. Excellent service provided by Hotel Manager (Mr Darwin), with his recommendations of good restaurants for dinning and his constant smile that makes you feel so welcoming from beginning to the end of stay. 3. Hotel is very clean, good spread of breakfast, very friendly service staff. 4. Cannot find any fault with this hotel ;-) Definitely highly recommended to anyone who wants to enjoy their stay in Venice, Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Redefined in Venice”
Reviews.Author: sdguru
Reviews.Content: This place brings peace and calm to Venice. It's well tucked away from the noisy streets of Venice. Darwin/Matteo at the front desk were very accomodative of our request to switch our room to 1st Floor. They even attended to our special requests for Breakfasts and Snacks w/ no fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence, with Service that can not be beat...”
Reviews.Author: katezb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the beautiful, elegant Hotel Palazzo Abadessa and our stay could not have gone better. Our hotel managers, Darwin and Matteo, were amazing. Their recommendations and suggestions were great. They left us wanting for nothing. If you want a very beautiful hotel with excellent, personalized service then Hotel Palazzo Abadessa is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Venetian Palace”
Reviews.Author: JasmineBelgrado
Reviews.Content: I was here with my boyfriend for a romantic weekend...we had a very nice junior suite on the noble foor with the view on the canal...Breakfast was so delicious and the staff welcoming and helpful...The hotel is very quite and also very close to Rialto and San Marco...The garden is the top! So beautiful and sweet!...I reccomend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Abadessa”
Reviews.Author: nichollsb01
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a surprise anniversary trip to Venice, it was amazing. It is located 2 min walk off the main street so really convenient but you also feel like you are in your own little part of Venice. The hotel is pure Venetian, fantastic decor and traditional. The staff are so friendly and nothing is too much trouble, they even have massive umbrellas you can borrow when it is raining! We were shown two rooms on arrival and were able to pick our favourite and because it was our anniversary we had a complimentary bottle of Prosecco and were upgraded on our anniversary night - what a special touch. Breakfast is continental but plentiful, the fruit and pastries were so fresh and the coffee fantastic. I would recommend this hotel to all but especially couples looking for a romantic break.

Reviews.Title: “All we could have hoped for :)”
Reviews.Author: aubin785
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing place to stay.How could you not be happy here! The building is beautiful and maintains its charm & serenity, the staff are all so helpful & gracious.You can walk easily to any area, explore the quiet backwaters or head off to the busstling centre. The breakfast was superb with plenty of everything to set you up for the day and the coffee was excellent. We had the joy of venice in the snow so didn't eat in the courtyard! It looks very beautiful though. There was a great street market around the corner, loads of fantastic eateries everywhere.and a food store nearby. Arriving or departing by water taxi from the hotel water gate looked so cool .....maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: veryhappy78
Reviews.Content: What a treat! My husband and I loved everything about the Abadessa Hotel. Located in a quiet neighborhood yet central to everything in Venice, we could not have asked for anything more. Being there at the beginning of October meant spectacular weather without the huge summer crowds. This only added to the experience of our stay at this beautiful hotel. We were treated as if we were family. The staff went out of their way to offer helpful advice on places to see and restaurants. Our room was quite small but was fine for us. The bathroom was clean and adequate. The breakfast buffet was delicious! Probably our favorite area of the hotel was the beautiful, quiet garden. After a day of touring in Venice, it was a delight to sit back and relax with a cool beverage to gather our second wind! We heartily recommend the Abadessa to one and all!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing surprise”
Reviews.Author: Amazed1957
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this beautiful hotel along with our wedding guest. We had eleven rooms and every room was a different slice of Venice. The staff was amazing and they contributed making our Venetian wedding a wonderful and memorable experience that is being talked about in Jamaica even now over two months later. My wife will never forget the playing of the wedding march with the entire staff applauding as she descended the stairs to get to the water taxi. You will not regret this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Zahra_10
Reviews.Content: Room was stylish, extremely clean, well appointed, wonderful heating/cooling control, with very comfortable beds. Another feature worth pointing out was that the hotel was in the heart of Venice and close to the shopping street and water bus station and very quiet despite being near to a busy environment with fantastic garden. The staff were extremely helpful, polite, and attentive to a guests needs. Zahra from Iran

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Lovely place where a local would feel like royalty”
Reviews.Author: TBHeller
Reviews.Content: Abadessa is not a typical hotel by any means. Large courtyard, variety of unique very good quality rooms, nice ballroom, quiet, very friendly and accommodating staff. We have stayed here twice and it inspired us in many ways. I am not sure we will ever stay at another Venice hotel. We will be back. The most enjoyable way to arrive and depart is by water taxi direct to their canal door. It is not busy and always feels calm when Venice just a few blocks away can be so busy and crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all round experience”
Reviews.Author: sandcastle99
Reviews.Content: We initially had booked for one night but liked the hotel - and it's location - so much that we stayed for a second night. The staff were attentive and helpful (particularly Matteo) without being overbearing and whilst our room was small, it had everything in it and a super view over the canal. The hotel also had a gorgeous garden and was very close to everthing yet extremely peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “great, unpretentious but still a little palace”
Reviews.Author: auroramarquard
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week earlier this year, 2010. It is in a quiet part of the city next to a small canal. the staff are friendly, speak excellent English and made good dinner suggestions. Best to book one of the bigger rooms. Ours had a painted ceiling and great light from two windows. It is off the main tourist routes so quiet and without the frenzy of some areas of Venice in season. The hotel has been carefully converted from its original function as a palace, yet retains the feel of a wonderful home to a prosperous family. Great value in an over priced city! The breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated and quiet with excellent beds and fine breakfast”
Reviews.Author: logie3343
Reviews.Content: Sophisticated Palazzo well away from the tourist trail, yet within walking distance of the entire city. Very helpful reception and fine breakfast with excellent coffree.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Biggesthead
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one nice gem in Venice. Hidden away from tourist traffic, yet close enough to all the attractions. The hotel staffs (including the owners I think) were extremely courteous and helpful. While the breakfast was nothing out of the ordinary, but the fact you can enjoy it in their nice quiet courtyard was definitely a plus. I will definitely consider staying there again next time I am on Venice. Two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “A very special place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: OttawaTraveller_10
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults and 2 teens) had a wonderful stay at Palazzo Abadessa. The hotel and garden are beautiful, and the staff was very helpful. Darwin and Sylvana were always happy to answer our questions and to make dinner reservations. The rooms were very "venetian", spacious, clean and comfortable. The included breakfast was the best we had during our entire vacation, and being able to eat in the private garden made it very memorable. We hope to return someday in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The most romantic place you can find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Marianne075
Reviews.Content: We visit Hotel Palazzo Abadessa in august 2010 and had the most perfect memorable stay. Hotel Palazzo Abadessa is situated central in Venice but at the same it is like an oasis when stepping into the garden of Hotel Palazzo Abadessa.. quite and beautiful. It is like entering another world when you stay at this hotel. The rooms are beautifull furnished and a tour around the hotel with a camera is absolutely recommended. The hotel is small and that also means that you get to know the staff very well during your stay and the service is absolutely high. We had the most fantastic stay in Venice but the stay at Hotel Plazzo Abadessa was a great part of this experience. We hope to get back soon :o) best regards RenÃ© & Marianne Denmark

Reviews.Title: “A friendly and relaxing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Denise060
Reviews.Content: My husband, thirteen year old son and myself stayed at Palazzo Abdessa,Venice in July for 3 nights as part of our 5 week holiday from Australia. After alighting steam boat number one at Car d' Ore we had a 2 minute walk down a narrow laneway to the green door-the entrance to Palazzo Abdessa. Our initial view was the lush green garden and welcoming garden settings which we later took advantage of with our bottle of complimentary champagne. We were quickly greeted by Sylvania who was extremely friendly and knowledegeable about the history and sights of Venice, including tips of places to dine away from the large tourist areas. The palazza was serviced 24 hours and we found all staff from the lady who prepared our buffet breakfasts, day and night staff to be friendly and helpful. After Rome, this really did feel like a comforting haven to return to after a days sight seeing. The palazzo also has it's own water canal where by you can arrive by water taxi. Sylvania made herself totally available to her guests to share her knowledge when they sought it, otherwise you were left to enjoy the tranquility.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: freckle1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights last week and loved it. We had a standard room (11) which, while nowhere near as grand as the suites, was really lovely. We had a view of the canal from all three of the rooms windows. The walls were covered in silk covering and there were murano glass light fittings. The room was plenty big enough as had a warm and romantic charm. The breakfast was fantastic and the staff very friendly. The best thing about the palace however is the location. Canneregio is a lovely district and within a couple of minutes walk to the no.1 Vaparetto stop at Cal d'Oro. It is however just the right distance from the maddening crowds! Overall a great experience for our first trip to Venice and I hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “A little palace to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: mali2007
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I loved its charming garden, a total gem in the middle of a busy beautiful city. I loved the rooms, the lobby, the lovely sitting room, I loved it all. We had two dbl rooms and both were luxuriously furnished and decorated. The common areas are full of antiques, beautiful period pieces. They even have some frescos what is left from them from a few hundred years ago on the walls. Great staff; they were always ready to help, and were pleasant at all times. Breakfast was consistently good every day. Location is perfect, it is in a residential area, so you are close to all the great spots in Venice but not too close to be bothered by the crowds. It is a quiet location within walking distance to everything. I will be sure to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Venice we love you...”
Reviews.Author: kmsmith_1
Reviews.Content: Last Monday me and my sister decided to make ourselves a gift and we went to Venice for some days , since we both had 3 free days. We immediately booked our flight tickets online and we also found a really convenient last minute offer online at the Westin Europe & Regina Hotel . We arrived around 10 am and we were very welcomed . We checked in quickly also if it was early , went to our beautiful room , then immediately to the city centerâ€¦..all very easy !!!The staff was great..and the breakfast in the morning was delicious, fresh fruits, cereals, fresh pastries â€¦ ! Thank you all for this weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: PackYourBags2003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Palazzo Abadessa in Venice, Italy. The moment we walked in, the staff was there with a warm welcome. They couldn't do enough for us. The room we stayed in was beautiful. Taken back from the days of romance and charm. It was very enchanting. We instantly became close to the owner and staff. Laughing and having wonderful conversations. They really felt like family. The breakfast in the morning was delicious. Many cheeses, fresh meats, danish, fresh fruits, and an assortment of many satisying morsels to enjoy. What a wonderful way to start the day. And the coffee.....delicious! The views from the windows are breathtaking. I couldn't stop looking out the windows watching all the life around me. I can't say enough about Palazzo Abadessa. It is our favorite place we have ever stayed. And we have traveled many places in the past years. It is very relaxing. The entire visit there was absolutely fantastic. When we left, my heart ached. The thought of not returning for a number of years had me saddened. This place is a gem. I felt very privileged to be a guest there. It has such a magical feel when you are there. It's hard to describe. I would recommend this place a million times over. You are lucky if you are among the ones that get to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Wow! Wow!”
Reviews.Author: majewski25
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt one of the top places I have ever stayed at. The hotel was breathtaking, the staff was second to none. The location was close to all sites and waterways to get to a particular location, Breakfast was fantastic. The room itself was lovely and inviting. Yes, it is air conditioned, and the bathroom was perfect. But most of all I want to comment about the staff. Anything and everything we wanted was done to perfection. I highly reccommend this hotel. It is a fantastic value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a great place”
Reviews.Author: Francis310883
Reviews.Content: I was there one month ago and I really enjoyed my stay in this beautiful old fashion venitian style Hotel. Our room was overlooking the quiet garden where you can have a drink on a day time. The staff had been really helpful. I would particularly thank a guy, whose name is Matteo, who answered to all our questions, which were so many!! I hope we didn't stress you too much :/ if you wanna go there, I absolutely recommend it! A wonderful place for an amzing city!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Stay in Venice- Hidden Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: RickTour22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a true Venetian experience and we were lucky enough to hear about Palazzo Abadessa from an article out of the UK strictly by chance and we were so THRILLED with our stay. We were greeted with the absolutely most delightful staff. Silvana, the hotel manager and her co-workers could not have possibly been kinder. BUT first, the setting! We wanted a place away from Piazza San Marco and after a brief vaporetto ride from the train station, you arrive in this hip, residential area of the city which to us, made it so unique and special. A few windy narrow turns and you arrive at this amazing palazzo, not a gaudy, overdone hotel, but like you are staying in some fabulous Venetian person's home. What more do you want?!! So after you walk through their garden, which is there for your enjoyment, they hand you a giant, funky old key to open your door - so much fun! No silly code key, and once again, you feel like a house guest. Our room was ridiculous! We had a bottle of Prosseco waiting for us upon arrival. It was furnished with all authentic venetian antiques, just as the entire palazzo is. Our ceiling was hand painted and we had wonderful windows that overlooked the residences close by. Breakfast was included and it was the best we had in Italy, complete with fresh fruit, meats, tarts, breads, cereal, the works. You can enjoy that in the garden or inside and oh, I forgot to mention, they have their own little dock at the back of the hotel, so when the door is open you have a water view! One evening we asked Silvana about a show in town. There are so many incredible small concerts, operas and ballets taking place and I recommend you make the time to see one. She went so far and beyond to accommodate us. She helped us choose and then handled all the accommodations including dinner before at a place near by. I can say with absolute certainty that if I am lucky enough to return to that incredible, magical city, Palazzo Abadessa is where I will be resting my head. We were in Italy for 9 days and spent time in Florence, Venice and Rome and I have been to Italy a number of times in the past- this hotel experience was outstanding! Spread the word about this place, they are not a "hotel" but if you like a boutique hotel/bed and breakfast style this is your spot! Don't miss out!!

Reviews.Title: “AN OASIS OF CALM”
Reviews.Author: Saskiagrav
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Abadessa was recommended to me by a friend , The welcome of the staff is wonderful, the price very reasonable for what you get, and the comfort supreme. Each room is different with its own unique ambience. The bathrooms are spacious, well equipped and function well. This is a boutique hotel, for those seeking a stay in an authentic Venetian Palace, the owner has painstakingly restored this palace without the kitsch that could have been mistakenly employed by others less sympathetic to the buildings history. It has integrity, a genuineness, and for history buffs and lovers of fine places. Its a living museum , so please take it for what it is and realise you are staying in a historic place and feel the privilege for being able to do that. Its not for those who wish perfection in all things, its for those who find this type of place perfect for them. Its different, and in a very nice way. I would recommend the canal side rooms, but all the rooms are great in their own way. Yes I will stay here again, it is a true Venetian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was staying at a good friend's house--that happended to own a palazzo”
Reviews.Author: asz001
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing with our two young girls. For easter, they gifted them two huge chocolate eggs. The rooms are very elegant and the neighborhood thankfully quiet. The Cannaregio district feels more "real" than the over-touristed Plaza San Marcos area. It is a long walk however to the sites of the city. This was my second trip to Venice, so I was happy to explore a new neighborhood. The one alert regarding this hotel is that the kids slept in a loft above us and the bathroom was at the loft level. If you have to go the bathroom at night, it does involve going up a flight of stairs. Would not recommend our room to family with children younger than 6, because of somewhat low rail height on loft.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in traditional palazzo”
Reviews.Author: ballyspurge
Reviews.Content: The staff were kind and welcoming to a fault. Nothing was too much trouble including finding a local church prepared to allow a tourist to play the organ. They also gave good recommendations for restaurants and concerts and were very helpful when we found ourselves stranded due to the volcano. We had a large light room with 3 windows overlooking the small canal that runs past the hotel. Pretty painted furniture and a murano glass chandelier added to the atmosphere. The bathroom was small and bathless but I suspect that is not unusual in Venice. We loved the pretty garden and the fact that the building and furnishings of the public rooms were relatively unchanged from when it was a private house. The hotel is very close to the Rialto and to the Ca d'Oro vaporetto stop so getting around is easy. It was close to everything yet felt quiet and untouristy. There were lots of fairly basic restaurants nearby and getting to smart ones was also easy though booking ahead for these is important. It doesn't have a view of the lagoon or the grand canal but it is a beautiful, convenient and very friendly base for a stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: sfag
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned the Abedessa looks as good in the flesh as it does on its website. We had the green wallpapered room on the piano novella floor. It is called a suite despite having only one room. It is easily large enough for two adults and two children. When we arrived we were offered another room at no extra cost for the two children as one nearby was free. Very generous of the hotel. In short: Hotel â€“ Pleasant grandiose feel, elaborately decorated. Large rooms and tall ceilings. Service = 5 stars (very friendly and accommodating) Our room = 5 stars. Large, handsome & with air con. Breakfast = 3 stars. Nothing out of the ordinary really. No hot stuff. â€“ cold buffet. Coffee = great tasting. Complimentary stuff = bottle of wine, fruit & bottled water. Location = very good â€“ close to everything. Atmosphere â€“ quiet, No bar to congregate in and no lunch or evening meals although you can have coffee anytime. Internet = free â€“ wifi, not inside our room. Laptop available for use. Canals = One right at the door. Very clean. No smell Iâ€™m pleased to say. Trips = The hotel will organise a free water taxi trip from the door to Murano for a glass making demo. There is no obligation to buy, but lets face it, you probably will out of guilt.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem!”
Reviews.Author: Lieutenantdanmac
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Abadessa is the most beautiful and welcoming place I've every stayed - and I travel extensively for both business and pleasure. The owners, Maria Luisa and Batista, tend both the extraordinarily beautiful historic building and their guests with the utmost care. All the rooms are individual gems, boatsing antique tapestries and paintings, ornate ceilings and period furniture. The breakfast room has portal onto one of the canals where you can arrive in style on one of the ubiquitous water taxis. Most importantly, however, is the care with which the owners and their staff treat the guests. Everyone on staff makes a point of really getting to know the guests and their preferences, and they do everything they can to make one's stay as comfortable and luxurious as possible. I was introduced to Palazzo Abadessa by friends who stay there frequently. Upon my arrival, I was greeted by the staff as if I were family, and contiuned to be treated as such throughout my entire stay. I simply can't say enough in favor of this beautiful, idyllic retreat in the middle of one of the world's most fascinating cities. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “perfect in all respects, surpassed expectations”
Reviews.Author: UpintheAirMadrid
Reviews.Content: Usually staying in 5 star hotels, the traditional boutique hotel was perfect in all respects, far surpassing many 5 star hotels I have stayed. Location was ideal as a central base in Venice, and being very quiet. Rooms were heavenly. Staff very attentive, and overall service extremely high. There was no restaurant in the hotel, other than providing breakfast, but with the central location and an array of restaurants and cafes only minutes away, the was not an issue at all. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Palace - other wordly”
Reviews.Author: praguelife
Reviews.Content: You will feel like you are stepping into another century. Amazing place and great experience. And they were great with our dog too. I can imagine in nice weather the garden would be a wonderful refuge from being out in the city all day. Thanks for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “DESTINATION EUROPE APPROVES - AMAZING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DestinationEurope
Reviews.Content: Our agents and agency stayed here in November - this property truly is like staying in a museum. The character of this hotel is amazing - the furniture is all period pieces and the decor matches that of a true Venetian palace. We had the large suite with stairs and loft with a large canopy bed and two beds in the loft. Large ceilings and a private terrace overlooking a quiet canal. Away from the crowded and noisy Rialto and St Marks area, but only a five minute walk or so to either. Great property for Honeymoons especially. Breakfast is a very nice selection of cheeses, breads, cereals, juices and fruits. The staff is very helpful and attentive - I must thank Stefano and Matteo and Darwin for their assistance and attention during our stay. Kayla Zeigler Destination Europe

Reviews.Title: “large rooms wonderful, small rooms grim...”
Reviews.Author: StamfordRaffles
Reviews.Content: The reviews on here are mostly five or four star, which is probably true if you have one of the large rooms/suites (the clues are references to murano glass chandeliers, oil paintings, glorious furniture, large bathrooms, etc...) Be warned small rooms are grim, dank and dark, with cramped bathrooms and no sound proofing. If you have ordered a large room then great, the location is fabulous and the hotel sweet if eccentric. If you don't have a large room then go somewhere else because you will be miserable...

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and a lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: saabco
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Venice for the first time and stayed at Palazzo Abadessa, based on Trip Advisor reviews. We arrived by water taxi right to the front door. We had a lovely room with fresco ceiling, Murano chandelier, and a view over the canal. The bathroom was a little funky, but charming. Mateo was very helpful with directions and recommendations. Breakfast was served in a peaceful garden. The only problem, was a low doorway stepping into the bedroom, which my husband gouged his head on several times. Besides that it was a perfect stay, with easy access to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, looking forward to third”
Reviews.Author: max4321
Reviews.Content: Our second visit. Treated as one of the family by Darwin and Marie Louise Rossi ( the owner) Our last visit which was excellent I took five rooms for family celebration As regular visitor we were given an upgrade which was appreciated Lovely hotel, well situated, nice people, beautiful city. Do not forget however that Venice is a very expensive city and can be extremely crowded. This trip we did not even bother to go to St Marks but went to the Fenice opera, Torcello and the Bienalle. If you are used to and want Marriott style 5 star hotel with up to date technology this is not for you. If you want small boutique hotel where everyone knows your name and business then go to the Palazzo Max

Reviews.Title: “A magical hotel in a magical city”
Reviews.Author: Aushiker
Reviews.Content: We chose Palazzo Abadessa because of the wonderful reviews on Trip Advisor and everything they said was true! We are travelling for three months so cost is a factor but honestly although cliched how can you put a value on such wonderful service and genuine care. The location of the hotel is close to walk to everything even recovering from a sprained ankle, but far enough from the maddening crowds that it provided a quiet oasis. The garden was perfect for breakfast and pre dinner drinks, and when we turned up with provisions from the local supermarket for lunch we were provided with plates, and ice bucket & linen napkins - nothing was too much trouble. Stefano's dinner recommendations were spot on providing us with a true local experience - great food and atmosphere at reasonable prices. We stayed in the smallest room that was still air conditioned and had a view of the canal. Forget staying at the big hotels, stay in this small luxury hotel, and be welcomed by passionate Italians who welcome you into their home.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite - everything an independent luxury hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: TeddySpaghetti
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palazzo Abadessa for a long week end with our 16 month old son. The palazzo and our room were beautifully furnished and decorated with handmade silk wallhangings, original art, murano chandeliers and a host of other original materials. The husband and wife owners were absolutely delightful and nothing was too much troube for them and their excellent staff, from fresh milk in the middle of t he night for our son to a personal tour of the of the palazzo, its fine details and their history by the owner. The location was excellent, in a neighbourhod venetian area and away from the hustle and bustle of tourist Venice but only a short stroll to the sights, Grand Canal and north to Fondamenti Nuove for the lagoon. The overall sense was one of staying as a private guest in someone's luzury home rather than in a hotel. Whilst not as overtly opulent as other top-end luxury hotels, the real luxury was in the combination of elegance, history and personal attention and service. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “hotel Palazzo Abadessa”
Reviews.Author: familytrek
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a gem, truly beautiful! A step back into time. The Palazzo Abadessa was everything we had hoped for and more. Upon our arrival, we were greeted with such warmness and sincerity and treated fabulously throughout our stay. Everything was perfect. Even our children were impressed! Can't wait to return some day and recapture the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to your home”
Reviews.Author: Vacation111
Reviews.Content: We were greeted like that and I wondered what that meant, at the end of our trip we found out what that meant: They did everything possible to make you feel at home, beginning with the champagne in the room, water and everything else. When we returned from a long day we were asked what we wanted and it was right there. The rooms were absolutely beautiful, one of the bathrooms was huge!!! Darwin was so nice and made everything possible, Thanks for a perfect stay, we will be back

Reviews.Title: “A real find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tim_H_from_Lincs_UK
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, where the owners have really spent time and energy on individual high quality decor. The rooms are a good size and our bathroom was unique, with a huge old stone sink integrated into a modern bathroom. # It is well located, only 3 minutes walk from the Ca'doro Vaporetto stop. Very unusually there is a garden in this central location which is great for breakfast. The mini bar, including a bottle of spakling wine appeared to be free!! No prices and no-one asked when we left. Without hesitation we would stay here again when we next visit Venice. Well done Abadessa a first rate job.

Reviews.Title: “Big mistake do not make the same one.”
Reviews.Author: Rragosta
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel by water taxi. Immediately upon our arrival we were greeted and instead of showing us to our 2 rooms the desk person showed us a room he would upgrade us to the next day. We did not request an upgrade. Finally he showed my wife and I to our room on the first floor near the dock 1. The shower flooded the floor everytime we used it. The staff was surpised at this. 2. Neither room had hot water when we showered before dinner. The staff seemed surprised at this. 3. Our room had no safe 4. Our room had low ceilings and there is no soundproofing and the toliet for the room above us was directly over the head of our bed so that loud urination and other things and flushing and stomping kept us awake all night. The staff seemed surprised at this!! 5. We gave up both rooms for the 2 bed 1 bath upgrade and they refused to adjust the bill for the bad room and charged us for our son's room even though we gave it up at their request. 6. Upon returning from dinner reception refused to get drinks for guests at 10:00pm and told them to get them from their rooms. There was no wine in the rooms. You cannot make this up! HORRIBLE! Too many other hotels in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “A very special place”
Reviews.Author: Midigama
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, very close to grand canal and boat stop but residential and quiet. Extremely helpful and genuine lovely staff, good restaurant recommendations and airport transfer advice and wonderful breakfast service and room service. Water taxi from hotel steps to airport extremely efficient (although took only half the time suggested - maybe the boatman was speeding?). Alternatively hotel walkable in 20 minutes from the bus station with good map/GPS and small/light wheelie bag (there are bridges to negotiate). Amazing building, period/antique decoration and furniture - which will not suit those who prefer minimalist decor. Garden fantastic for breakfast etc, weather permitting. A really amazing wedding anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Not enough air, but a nice experience overall”
Reviews.Author: ThereseA
Reviews.Content: The location of the Palazzo was excellent, but still very quiet. We liked the neighbourhood and could walk anywhere we would like to go. In the morning we would wake up to the sound of birds singing and to the smell of newly baked bread. The service we got at the front desk and at breakfast was also splendid. The only thing that bothered us was our room. When we arrived at the hotel, the first thing that struck us was that our room didn't have air. Even when we opened the large window, the air wasn't enough. At night we had to sleep with the window open. Because of the pricy room rate we had quite high expectations on the hotel, and in this regard it didn't fulfil our expectations. But overall, we would recommend the Palazzo to our friends and family. It was a nice experience to stay in the old palace and such luxury being able to have breakfast in the front garden.

Reviews.Title: “With the Right Expectations You Will Love the Palazzo Abadessa”
Reviews.Author: Adzema
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice for the first time for our ten year anniversary the week before USA Thanksgiving (missed the flooding, thank goodness!). We had room #23, a large corner room overlooking the canal (which is no longer under construction as far as we could tell). Venice, overall, is like an echo chamber with all of the stone and you can hear everything happening outside your windows, but this is not a problem just with the Palazzo Abadessa, simply an observation about staying in the city that applies to the P.A. and, my guess is, most hotels in town. It was chilly, so we didn't get to use the garden, but it was lovely anyhow. The breakfast was excellent. I was very happy to have my Parma ham with butter and toast every morning. Housekeeping was well done and timely. The Palazzo itself is charming and vintage. I wanted to feel like I'd stepped back in time and the P.A. accomplished this without having creaky beds, too much lace, and the other dusty trappings of an older hotel or B&B. The location is also good, very near the Rialto, the Ca'D'Oro stop and also the vaparetto stop for going out to Murano and Burano. Our only negative comments are that the bathroom we had (in a large room, even by US standards) was very narrow and the shower stall was so small we had logistical trouble taking a shower. Our other comment was the front desk staff, while getting an "A" for effort and sweetness often were just not very knowledgeable about basic Venetian information, like a restaurant open at 4:30 in the afternoon that served pasta (couldn't give us one recommendation in the entire city) or the cost of a taxi to the airport (had to call several people and then quoted us a price way more than it ended up being). We seemed to stump them with basic requests and it got to the point where we just stopped asking as it wasted time and got us nowhere. Strangely, email communication before we arrived was very helpful and the opposite of our experience in person. I suppose the moral is arrange as much as you can in advance via email. I recommend the P.A. very highly, but you need to go in with the right expectations. If you are expecting five star bathrooms and concierge service, you will be disappointed. All else was wonderful if not superior to a five star (in terms of service, size and charm).

Reviews.Title: “excellent in all categories”
Reviews.Author: jochenm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at P.A. for our wedding (but didn't use it as a reception site) and had a total of 4 rooms, incl. the big suite. What a wonderful place. Service (unusually friendly, knowledgabe and customer oriented for Venice standard), Character (very tasteful decorations, authentic renovations), Atmosphere (huge and very quiet garden, yet very central; huge rooms, great breakfast, only a few rooms/guests) and value for price were just outstanding. We felt almost like at home, it is a true oasis in hectic Venice. Ideal for refuge seekers who enjoy a classy and upscale, unique environment and who appreciate art and history. Not for bargain seekers or party animals. We've been to Venice probably 20 times before , and P.A. has been the best experience so far, incl. Danieli. Staff/receptionists speak english, and are very helpful. No dinner or food beyond (the rich, cold plates) breakfast, which was fine with us as it keeps the place quiet in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous palace in heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelMerrickNy
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience !!!!!!!!! Darwin , Guiseppe, Rolly,and Stefano were so professional during our stay. Our room was so charming and immaculate. The gardens were beautiful, and it was so peaceful sitting with my family in the morning enjoying a delicious breakfast. My teenage son fell in love with this charming palace. So convenient to use water ferry or simply walk 10 minutes to St Mark's square. We definitely will return to your hotel!!!! Thanks for arranging private tour of Murano and making reservations at Algiubagio.

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil and beautiful sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: Boingy_breaks
Reviews.Content: Don't really need to say too much as all the other reviews are glowing too. Had the nicest time. A quiet gem just off the main drag so very well located but nothing but birdsong and tolling bells to disturb the peace. Sweet and pretty garden was a treat to sit and have breakfast there. And what a lovely breakfast too - fresh fruit, yoghurt, breads, cheeses and meats, and cake! Mm. Very friendly and helpful personal service. A nice touch was the open bar - set of spirits and wines available with compliments in the main reception hall. Beautifully decorated rooms with silky fabric walls, high ceilings (we stayed in room 21 - had a mezzanine level). Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Bliss”
Reviews.Author: byrninrubber
Reviews.Content: If I start with the superlatives, I am at risk of being unable to control myself. This was my third trip to Venice (takiing my sister as a special treat). I booked Palazzo Abadessa on the basis of other reviews on this sight, and I am so glad that I did. Still, I was prepared to wear the "Been There, Done That" T-shirt, but Palazzo Abedessa provided that rare combination of beautiful surrounding with extraordinary customer service. Claudio and Wolfgang deserve some sort of hotelier's medal as do the rest of the staff at this Venice oasis. Nothing is too much trouble; Restaurant recommendations were excellent and tea in the garden was so lovely we made a point of returning every day just to rest and enjoy the garden Room 23 is simply beautiful: painted ceiling, handpainted furniture, padded damasked walls, over-looking the canal...quiet location, comfortable bed, clean..ETC ETC ETC!!! Basically, I would just like to be adopted by the brilliant staff at Abadessa and get to live out the rest of my years being looked after by them...alternatively, I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: why111
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel, warm welcome and nothing too much trouble. Breakfast in the garden was delicious and tranquil. Lit up with fairy lights at night. A few (quiet) minutes walk away from a busy street with lovely shops, restaurants etc. Near to water bus stops. Would highly recommend it. Canal works still going on but not really invasive.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in a museum”
Reviews.Author: frobnitz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. It was quiet, everything was clean, and the rooms were beautiful. It was like staying in a museum. Service is great. The owner is a wonderful woman who was there every morning at breakfast. The breakfast was also good, far better than the other places we stayed. Beware the water taxis from the train station though. The canals are being worked on and they don't want to take the extra five minutes of detours to get to the hotel, so they try to drop you at a 15 minute walk over two bridges but charge you full fare. Our only complaints are a problem with confirming the dates - we had to stay at another hotel because they didn't have the right start date, and the insecticide "air fresheners" they use in the rooms, probably to keep the bugs from eating the wall hangings. Highly recommend this over the other places we stayed at in Venice. For the space and private baths versus what you pay in the more touristy areas, this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Romance”
Reviews.Author: Bibawi
Reviews.Content: It was the begining of our honeymoon and what a start. We were welcomed at the reception with a smile and a proseco. The entrance was throgh a fabulous garden which is uncommon in Venice. The room was splendid, huge and full of antique furniture. Knowing that we were honeymooners we found beautiful orchids in the room. The second day we found a bottle of chamagne surrounded with chocolate, biscuits ans sweets with a nice card from the staff. Breakfast was in the garden with silver cutlery. Very tasty and generous. Snacks and all sorts of drinks are left for you to enjoy a romantic drink in the ancient and elegant hall or in the garden, We stayed 5 nights and on our deperature a nice elegant staff member helped us with our luggage till the boat. It was a memorable stay and will go back again in one of our anniversaries!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with this price”
Reviews.Author: TravelProNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights from August 22nd. Compare to the price and quality to other hotels in Venice, we are very satisfied with Palazzo Abadessa. Very Venetian, great staff, wonderful breakfast, close to all major attraction but quiet area, great location. If you are looking for full service 5 star hotel with 500Euro a night, this is not for you. If you are looking for more than what you pay, this is the one. But definately we will stay here again next time we visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent anniversary in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TravelerSteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights and had an excellent time. Room was very nice and staff very friendly. Breakfast was very nice particularly in the garden with perfect weather for our visit. We liked the location which was a bit off from the heavy crowds but only about 20 minute walk to about anywhere. The only downside was the construction in back of the hotel on the canal. We really did not notice it during the stay except for Monday morning when they started working at around 8 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at Palazzo Abadessa!”
Reviews.Author: KPav22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palazzo Abadessa for three nights from August 19-22 and had a fabulous experience. We truly found the hotel to be an oasis away from the tourist crowded streets of Venice. We had a terrible flight experience on our way into Venice which included delays, re-routing and lost luggage. Upon arrival Darwin welcomed us and informed us that our room had been upgraded to a beautiful suite. We had champagne and snacks waiting as an anniversary surprise for us when we walked up to the suite. He also called the airlines every hour on the hour to make sure that our luggage would be found! Breakfast was a great start to the day and the cappucino was fabulous. We found the location of the hotel to be perfect... within walking distance to everything major including the Rialto Bridge area, Saint Mark's Square, and some really fun restaurants and Osterias (we highly recommend the Osteria al Bomba around the corner from the hotel). The lack of the canal in front of the hotel was disappointing, but it certainly didn't detract from our stay. (And it appears from the construction that the work will be done soon... they had started refilling the canal while we were there.) Overall our stay at the Palazzo Abadessa was exceptional. We highly recommend the Palazzo Abadessa.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: tonigb1
Reviews.Content: Two days were added to our trip when Delta called to say we could fly direct if we left on the 5th instead of the 7th. No problem, but when our hotel in Venice couldn't extend our reservation we looked around for another. Can't remember how we found Palazzo Abadessa - especially since it's in the Cannaregio and we, like most people who visit Venice, thought you must stay near San Marco! What a delightful surprise on both counts! The location for the hotel is just minutes from the Ca' d'Oro vaporetto stop but except for the Arsenalle it's a relatively easy walk to everything. We walked to Zanpolo, San Polo, Rialto, the Ghetto, San Marco. It's just a block off Strada Nouve with lots of shops and restaurants but not the hordes. The hotel itself was lovely; it appears not too many years removed from being someone's private residence. The public rooms were like museums. This was our second trip to Venice, and I didn't think gardens like this existed among the alleys and waterways. Think lush and green. The perfect setting for a late night complementary aperitivo provided the hotel. Our room was an adequate size with a larger than average bath, elegant and clean. Yes, there was the business about the canal under repair, but noise didn't begin before 8:00am and I wasn't in Venice to sleep in. The breakfast was probably the best we had on this trip and eating in the garden added a special touch. All the staff were very gracious and helpful. We couldn't have been more pleased that circumstances allowed us to experience this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, nice decor”
Reviews.Author: Euro-plane
Reviews.Content: Very nice property, delicious breakfast, but it did not vary...same thing day after day. We stayed at property for 3 nights, and yes the canal was torn up and very noisy (which was quite the diappointment. I don't htink that the management of this hotel knew how to handle this canal problem and I heard some other guests bothered by the problem. We had heard so much about this hotel owners but never got a chance to meet them. Maybe they got out when the canal got emptied. Murano glass chandeliers, paintings on ceilings, fabric walls, intermmittent internet in breakfast room. Hopefully canal will be filled soon.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, with one problem”
Reviews.Author: mike55401
Reviews.Content: After much investigation, and after reading the rave reviews on this website, I decided the best bet for me and my two friends was the Palazzo Abadessa. Overall, we were completely satisfied. The property is gorgeous, well situated near the Ca' d'Oro stop, and the staff is quite attentive. The breakfasts were superlative. It was wonderful. Our only complaint was our room. Me and my two friends were travelling together across Europe, spending each night together as we rarely see each other. Many weeks prior to our arrival, I booked a room for the three of us. I recieved a confirmation at that time. A couple of weeks prior, I reconfirmed. I received another very nice email that our reservation was confirmed. Finally, I sent one last email the day prior to our leaving for Europe to say how we were looking forward to our time there. I again recieved an email confirming and saying that they intended to provide us with the best hotel experience we ever had. So, with this, we were all suprised to arrive at the hotel saying that we would have to be put in another room for the first two nights, and split up altogether the last night because our original reserved room was unavailable. This was very disappointing to us as we had confirmed multiple times prior to our arrival. To the hotel's credit, the first two nights were an upgrade to possibly the best room in the house. The only downside to it was that the canal outside our window was being repaired so it had been drained completely (with bad smell coming in the room) and the workers started outside our window very early. Overall, the room was wonderful. After these two nights, we had to repack our things which was an inconvenience in order to move into another room. The last night was a definite downgrade from what we had reserved. It was a clean, nice, but small. So we were separated our last night which was not to our liking. I guess the hotel's philosophy was that since they had upgraded us the first two nights, a downgrade on the last night was ok. I cannot stress enough that I think the hotel is beautiful. Our experience was unfortunate and apparently not common for most people staying there. That said, I would still suggest this to anyone wanting to stay in a real Venetian palazzo with a not-so-common garden that is beautifully tended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms”
Reviews.Author: HampshireTrip
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel for a 3 night stay, and were told that we'd have to change rooms after 2 nights. We weren't impressed, but were told we had been upgraded, so we didn't say anymore. And WOW and were we glad we didn't. The room we had for 2 nights was amazing, palace decor - painting on ceiling, chandaler, 17th century furniture etc... and absolutely massive. Also included was a free bottle of champagne. Breakfast was nice and had a huge range to choose from, and sitting eating in the garden to start the day was perfect. The member of staff on days was very, very friendly and helpful, and advised on entertainment, and booked a night at the Opera for us, gave directions, and it was a superb night. Overall this is an excellent hotel, with fabulous pictures and furniture where ever you look. The one down side, which affected us on the first morning, was the work currently being done on the canal outside. The upgraded room backed onto the work, and at 7:30 woke us up. But with breakfast starting at 8:30, who wants to lay in bed sleeping when in Venice? Would definitely choose this hotel again, and once canal work complete, would give it 5 stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “No water, no view, canal all torn up......”
Reviews.Author: Mexi-Can8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at this 15th C Palazzo. Beautiful property, very good breakfast, and afternoon drinks. Air conditioning good, clean, and friendly employees (usually). Problems with the following; do not get or pay extra for canal view. The canal is torn up and the view is poor at best from our second story windows if the canal wasn't drained. Again they did not tell me either, even when I contacted them 1 week prior to our arrival. Not very helpful with recommendations and the local restaurant scene. Everything is very expensive here, including this hotel. On the day of our arrival, after a 18 hour travel day, we did not have any water to shower until midnight that evening and there was non stop noise from the canal due to this construction. We were offered only 'bottled water' to take a shower with and no discount off our rate due to the non-existant canal view which we paid extra for...Garden is beautiful but can be noisy from neighbors playing disco music both in the morning and evening or slamming weights (a gym??). We too were sent to a restaurant that was closed when we go there and were given very poor directions and information on the "Doges Secret Tour" which we did not go on, because we were not given the confirmation number by the Abadessa staff who had graciously made the reservations for us, but neglected to give us detailed information on where to meet, time, etc. Internet service is hit and miss and you must ask for it to be turned on (wirelesss). The value in our stay was lacking at the Abadessa being our first time with added challenges from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “belissimo!! wonderful palazzo”
Reviews.Author: julieb26
Reviews.Content: Belissimo!! a wonderful palazzo run by wonderful people. we have just returned from a wonderful stay at the palazzo. we were here for six nights to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary, and what a place to stay. we were treated like special friends, and felt so welcome, the place is full of antiques and paintings and the rooms are so venetian in design with frescoed ceilings, silk walls and wonderfully comfortable beds,everything is so clean and immaculately kept, it really is a joy. we had a lovely breakfast in the garden every morning, with the wonderful owner Maria-louise there to greet you with a charming smile and a friendly cheerful word, making you feel special, making a great start to your day.Darwin was on hand to help with any enquiries, and was so kind to book us tickets to the opera, and recommended a restaurant, and promptly rang them to say we were coming. Venice is so magical and romantic, as is the Palazzo Abadessa,and this combination made our special time so wonderful. we will be back as fast as we can, Thank you ,Maria and all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: calitraveller15
Reviews.Content: Very pricey. . . but you get what you pay for. Excellent staff who make you feel like you are visiting their home (in fact the owner was there each day I was there and she made me feel like I was visiting her as a special guest). I had trouble with my luggage delivery (stuck in Italian customs . . . long story) and a staff member went out of his way repeatedly (calling customs and the package delivery service I was using) to get it to me before I left Venice and headed to my next destination. Location was quieter than most Venician hotels, which was very welcome. Nice courtyard, wonderful and plentiful breakfast, and evening hors d'oeuvres and bubbly that were among the best I have tasted. If you can afford it - GO!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Palazzo Abadessa
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Priuli, Cannaregio 4011, 30131 Venice, Italy
